parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate or party.  It discusses the Romanian National Integrated Plan in the field of Energy and Climate Change (PNIESC), a general policy matter.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its content is intended to reach a wide audience, not just specific individuals. The reach estimate is ">1M".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to inform the public about the PNIESC plan. While energy policy can indirectly influence voters' opinions, the post itself does not explicitly advocate for or against any candidate or party participating in the parliamentary elections. The content is primarily informational and educational.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post presents factual information about a government policy document, citing a source (https://energie.gov.ro/...). This aligns with journalistic standards of providing information to the public.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post does not express personal opinions; it presents factual information.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1293619921766929</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post by "Romania Eficienta" discusses the Romanian National Integrated Plan in the field of Energy and Climate Change (PNIESC).  This is a general policy matter, not directly related to the parliamentary elections. The post is informational, citing a government source, and does not advocate for or against any specific candidate or party.  While energy policy is a political issue, this post's primary purpose is to inform, not to influence the outcome of the parliamentary elections.  The lack of any reference to specific candidates or parties, combined with the informational nature of the content, suggests that it does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t).
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Romania Eficienta</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
